intro: Amauropelta sancta, commonly known as the sacred fern, is a rare and endangered species native to the tropical rainforests of Central and South America. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires consistent moisture and high levels of organic matter in the soil. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, Amauropelta sancta is critically endangered, highlighting the need for protective measures.
